p: The MIC values of T. zygis EO were in the range of 0.19 mg/mL to 0.78 mg/mL, while the MBC values were in the range of 1.56 mg/mL to 6.25 mg/mL. The most sensitive bacteria were isolated from male children (MIC at 0.19 mg/mL and MBC at 1.56 mg/mL). However, all the isolates reacted in the same way to R. officinalis (MIC from 1.56 to 3.125 mg/mL and MBC at 12.5 mg/mL). T. zygis EO demonstrated the highest antibacterial activity against E. coli isolates compared to O. majorana and R. officinalis.
